text: Jane had sent Caroline an early answer to her letter as soon as she was out of the question, do you like him?

passages.fragment: Jane had sent Caroline an early answer to her letter
passages.full_quote: <used>Jane had sent Caroline an early answer to her letter</used>, and was counting the days till she might reasonably hope to hear again

passages.fragment: answer to her letter as soon as she
passages.full_quote: Elizabeth had the satisfaction of receiving an <used>answer to her letter as soon as she</used> possibly could

passages.fragment: as soon as she was out of the
passages.full_quote: When dinner was over, she returned directly to Jane, and Miss Bingley began abusing her <used>as soon as she was out of the</used> room

I was indignant for a moment; but remembering that anger <used>was out of the question, a</used>nd that I had indeed appeared as a beggar to her, I answered quietly, but still not without a certain marked firmness -- "You are mistaken in supposing me a beggar"

passages.fragment: out of the question , do you like him
passages.full_quote: "Well, but, leaving his land <used>out of the question, do you like him</used>"
"You have spoken of him often: <used>do you like him</used>?"
